biolockj.module.implicit

Class ImportMetadata

  • java.lang.Object
    • biolockj.module.BioModuleImpl
      • biolockj.module.implicit.ImportMetadata
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    BioModule

    public class ImportMetadata
extends BioModuleImpl
implements BioModule
    This BioModule validates the contents/format of the project metadata file and the related Config properties. If successful, the metadata is saved as a tab delimited text file.

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from class biolockj.module.BioModuleImpl

      • executeTask

        public void executeTask()
                 throws Exception
        If Config."metadata.filePath" is undefined, build a new metadata file with only 1 column of sample IDs. Otherwise, import "metadata.filePath" file and call MetaUtil.refreshCache() to validate, format, and cache metadata as a tab delimited text file.
        Specified by:
        executeTask in interface BioModule
        Specified by:
        executeTask in class BioModuleImpl
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown if the module is unable to complete is task

      • getSummary

        public String getSummary()
                  throws Exception
        The metadata file can be updated several times during pipeline execution. Summary prints the file-path of the final metadata file, along with sample and field count (obtained from MetaUtil).
        Specified by:
        getSummary in interface BioModule
        Overrides:
        getSummary in class BioModuleImpl
        Returns:
        Module summary of metadata path, #samples and #fields
        Throws:
        Exception - if any error occurs

      • buildNewMetadataFile

        protected File buildNewMetadataFile()
                             throws Exception
        Create a simple metadata file in the module output directory, with only the 1st column populated with Sample IDs.
        Returns:
        Metadata file
        Throws:
        Exception - if unable to build the new file due to invalid params or I/O errors

      • formatMetaId

        protected String formatMetaId(String sampleIdColumnName)
        Format the metadata ID to remove problematic invisible characters (particularly converted Excel files). If the first Excel cell value starts with # symbol, Excel adds a ZERO WIDTH NO-BREAK space as an invisible character. Here we strip this value; See http://www.fileformat.info/info/unicode/char/feff/index.htm
        Parameters:
        sampleIdColumnName - Current name of metadata Sample ID column
        Returns:
        Formatted Sample ID column name

      • getQuotedValue

        protected String getQuotedValue(String val)
        The member variable quotedText caches the input held within a quoted block. This block can contain the Config."metadata.columnDelim" which will be read as a character. If val closes an open quoted block, the entire quotedBlock is returned (ending with Config."metadata.columnDelim" as all cells do) and the quotedText cache is cleared.
        Parameters:
        val - Parameter to evaluate
        Returns:
        Quoted text block (so far)

      • getSampleIds

        protected TreeSet<String> getSampleIds()
                                throws Exception
        Extract the sample IDs from the file names with SeqUtil.getSampleId(String)
        Returns:
        Ordered set of Sample IDs
        Throws:
        Exception - if any duplicate or invalid sample IDs are returned by SeqUtil

      • inQuotes

        protected boolean inQuotes(String val)
        Method called each time a line from metadata contains the Config."metadata.columnDelim". If the Config."metadata.columnDelim" is encountered within a quoted block, it should be interpreted as a character (not interpreted as a column delimiter).
        Parameters:
        val - Parameter to evaluate
        Returns:
        true if within open quotes

      • parseRow

        protected String parseRow(String line,
                          boolean isHeader)
                   throws Exception
        Method called to parse a row from the metadata file, where Config."metadata.columnDelim" separates columns. The quotedText member variable serves as a cache to build cell values contained in quotes which may include the Config."metadata.columnDelim" as a standard character. Each row increments rowNum member variable. When the header row is processed, colNames caches the field names.
        Parameters:
        line - read from metadata file
        isHeader - is true for only the first row
        Returns:
        parsed row value
        Throws:
        Exception - if required Config values are missing or invalid

      • verifyHeader

        protected void verifyHeader(String cell,
                            List<String> colNames,
                            int colNum)
                     throws Exception
        Verify column headers are not null and unique
        Parameters:
        cell - value of the header column name
        colNames - a list of column names read so far
        colNum - included for reference in error message if needed
        Throws:
        Exception - if a column header is null or not unique
